title: Kenai Fjords National Park: Birds
body: Birds        Two adult horned puffins fly across the water at Kenai Fjords. NPS / Jim Pfeiffenberger        Kenai Fjords National Park is a great place to see and learn about the birds of coastal Alaska. It is truly a birder's paradise!  Some of the spectacular feathered-friends that visit our park are...  Bald Eagle Black-Billed Magpie Black Oystercatcher Marbled Murrelet Murres (common and thick-billed) Peregrine Falcon Puffins (horned and tufted) Steller's Jay         Bird List A total of 191 species of birds have been documented in the park. Bird List (2007) - From the Southwest Alaska Network (SWAN) of the Inventory and Monitoring program of the National Park Service.                               Black Oystercatcher   8 Photos  Living its life between the crash of the waves, this iconic shorebird spends its days feeding in the rich intertidal zone.           Tufted and Horned Puffins   3 Photos  Kenai Fjords National Park is home to both tufted and horned puffins.           Bald Eagles   7 Photos  Bald eagles are one of most commonly seen inhabitants of Kenai Fjords.
